title: [GAMEPLAY] Lulu Polymorph does not cancel Darius Q
body:
When Polymorphing Darius while hes channeling his Q the skill will still trigger while hes a critter, dealing full dmg and healing him!
It "worked" every time, not a one time bug.
As far as im concerned polymorph is supposed to cancel spell channling (as its considered a silence).

replies.body: Darius Q CANT be canceled. stun / knockback / silence wont cancel it. and its not a "channel" its a "wind up" (wind up's cant be canceled)

okay didnt know that, thats kinda bullshitty to me...
as it seems you cant simply outplay/outtime a darius...
His q has a sweet spot, too far and he misses. Too close and he does half the damage and passive isn't stacked. It's also on a 1 second delay. Play around those mechanics.

It also does not heal inside that spot

Even thought i always found hard to get into there, i always end up getting caught by the eastern side by a sliver even while melee aaing
i have been having a problem where other champs can still auto while polymorphed. not sure if this is happening to anyone else or if I'm crazy but theyre basically cute champions that still kill me.
Spell casts can't be interrupted by anything except death - the best form of CC.

>
> Tahm cancels Darius Q.

No he doesn't. Darius Q even goes off when he gets nom'd.

As a Lulu main, I frequently notice how the Whimsy doesn't interrupt Master Yi's Alpha Strike.

I can see the ability is mid-air, but as the cooldown begins on spell _cast_ and not on spell _hit_, it goes on CD without doing anything to him when he uses his Q, as he then turns untargetable. Quite a lethal flaw.

Same issue with Fizz' troll pole, Vlad's troll pool, Lissandra's frozen tomb, and Elise's rappel.
_And on that note, R.I.P. old Fiora and her ultimate._
I thought suppresses could also cancel them. Might be wrong though.
Polymorph doesn't cancel Garens spin. Makes me sad, but it's pretty fair imo. Just use Glitter Lance instead of polymorph, or speed yourself up!
Good. Darius doesn't need nerfs like this.
